definition: disordered and in a mess (idiom); all mixed up and chaotic
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: Maybe it's just a fantasy, emerged from the disordered life.
sentences.chinese: 也許只是個臆想，從雜亂無章的生活裏蹦出的臆想。

sentences.english: All of the stuff on the fridge gave the impression of a cluttered room.
sentences.chinese: 冰箱裏所有的東西都給人一種雜亂無章的印象。

sentences.english: After too many operations, the ciphertexts would eventually become too noisy.
sentences.chinese: 經過過多的運算操作，暗文將最終變得雜亂無章。

sentences.english: Now, these pictures can be a bit messy.
sentences.chinese: 現在這些照片是雜亂無章的。

sentences.english: All kinds of vehicles weltered together.
sentences.chinese: 各種車輛雜亂無章地混在一起。

sentences.english: At his death, his heirs found only a mess of manuscripts.
sentences.chinese: 他死後，繼承人只找到一些雜亂無章的手稿。

sentences.english: Some of our dreams may be a haphazard mishmash of thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 我們的一些夢是雜亂無章的。

sentences.english: I can't put up with your untidiness any more.
sentences.chinese: 我再也不能忍受你的雜亂無章了。

sentences.english: The experiment went wrong because of hit-and-miss methods.
sentences.chinese: 這個實驗出了問題是因爲方法雜亂無章。

sentences.english: Visually, in large pages, this type of coding looks messy.
sentences.chinese: 在很大的網頁中，這編碼樣式看起來雜亂無章。

sentences.english: His argument is a ragbag of disconnected facts.
sentences.chinese: 他的論據是一堆雜亂無章互不相關的事實。

sentences.english: No cables, no muss, no fuss.
sentences.chinese: 沒有線纜，沒有雜亂無章。

sentences.english: Its origin is in tickling and rough-and-tumble play, he says.
sentences.chinese: 他說，笑的來源來自於撓癢癢以及雜亂無章的遊戲。

sentences.english: Mr Keller sees continuity where others see helter-skelter change.
sentences.chinese: 別人眼中雜亂無章的變遷在凱勒眼裏卻具有連續性。

sentences.english: Here in the heart of the sprawl, I’d found, well, heart.
sentences.chinese: 在這雜亂無章的中心，我恰恰找到了，心。

sentences.english: Both of you are disorganized incompetents.
sentences.chinese: 你們倆都是雜亂無章的低能。

definition: everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy
untainted by even a speck of dust (idiom); selfless and incorruptible/spotless
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
